description:
Quicktionary: (n) A quick, convenient, off-line dictionary. Also, a portmanteau of "Quick" and "Dictionary". 

Quicktionary1913 - This database is derived from the Webster's dictionary originally published in 1913.  It is fun to see how the language has changed in the last 99 years.   Checkout the screenshot's above for definitions like 'computer' and 'car'.

Quicktionary runs completely offline and give's lightning-fast word look-ups on a database of over 140,000 words. No network access is required to run this dictionary. Features 'RandomWord' - a fun button to learn new words. Also provides a list of possible word choices as you type characters into the search box. And most words within the definitions are also links to the definitions of those words. Just tap the words and definitions appear without delay. Great for writers, scrabble players, and anyone who likes learning and verifying.
